question: Paco had 6 cookies. He gave 30 cookies to his friend and ate 23 cookies. How many more cookies did he give to his friend than those he ate?
response:
Paco had 6 cookies initially. He gave 30 cookies to his friend, which means he had 30 - 6 = 24 cookies left. He ate 23 cookies, so he had 24 - 23 = 1 cookie left.

The answer is 1.
